alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 2:36PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Carbon and south central Albany Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 236 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northeast of North Fork Campground, or 22 miles northwest of Laramie, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Carbon and south central Albany Counties. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 285 and 304. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range
